title: Merchandising Manager
description:
The Category Merchandising Manager is a vital role in forecasting, buying, and allocating items for our various Retail Affiliates. You will be responsible in conceptualizing merchandising strategies to achieve sales, assorting goals and margin standards at an optimum inventory level. You'll also engage in supplier negotiations, product development, explore new trends and sources for new suppliers and present your strategies to top management.
Job Responsibilities:
Supervises buying and duties of merchandise assistants.
Forecasts departmental sales and margin goals.
Develops merchandise strategy for the department thus achieving sales and assortment goals margin standards at minimum inventory and markdown.
Controls open-to-buy, stock level and deliveries to stay within plans thus increasing turnover.
Negotiates with vendors for affordable costs, terms, and discounts.
Visits warehouse and stock rooms to ensure product quality, proper replenishment and display of merchandise.
Visits stores to check assortments of merchandise, display and old season merchandise.
Consults with store managers and other sales personnel on problems and suggestions.
Canvasses competitors regularly to evaluate their assortments, prices and merchandise presentation
Continuously explores new trends and new suppliers.
Prepares promotional plans, notes and analyzes results for future planning.

Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Retail Management, Management Business, or any related field.
At least 2 years of experience in buying, merchandising, or category management.
Experience should cover any retail category with demonstrated knowledge of merchandising principles and practices.
Strong negotiation, presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to speak in Mandarin/Fookien is highly advantageous
Willingness to travel for store and warehouse visits.
Travel requirements will be flexible and arranged as needed for store and warehouse visits.

Why Join CoreBridge Solutions?

title: AML/KYC* Compliance Analyst - Hybrid Working Arrangement
company: B & M Global Services Manila, Inc.
location: Bonifacio Global City, Taguig City, Metro Manila (Hybrid)
description:
The AML/KYC Compliance Coordinator will undertake detailed analytical research of clients and parties globally to provide efficient and effective Client Due Diligence (CDD) services to Firm Partners and local offices in new and existing client registrations and matters.
The role-holder will utilize knowledge and experience of Know Your Customer (KYC) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Sanctions screening activities to carry out risk-based reviews and make decisions to support timely client onboarding and matter processing, ensuring compliance with ethical, legal, and regulatory requirements. They will review and disposition alerts generated through screening clients and parties; conduct beneficial ownership investigations, and undertake periodic reviews of existing client profiles.
Responsibilities:
Undertake day-to-day compliance activities in line with AML obligations
Provide all aspects of support to the Firm, its Partners, and offices about the AML/KYC function within New Business Intake (NBI)
Diligently review and assess the AML and reputational risks associated with all new client and matter requests submitted via the Firm‚Äôs intake system (Intapp) to perform KYC/CDD
Perform detailed investigations to identify the presence of Politically Exposed Persons (PEPs) or Closely Related Associates (CRAs), Adverse Media, and Sanctions, utilizing several trusted industry sources (such as World-Check, D&B, Hoovers, Lexis Nexis), providing a concise rationale for false or positive ‚Äòmatch‚Äô decisions
Conduct independent verification of client due diligence information using additional research methods
Make sound and educated decisions regarding the existence and validity of possible AML, Sanctions, or reputational concerns and complete subsequent follow-up activities
Conduct thorough beneficial ownership investigations to provide results to local offices and ensure compliance with Firm policies and procedures
Thoroughly document research and analysis completed on clients and/or matters in a manner suitable for review by internal and external stakeholders, e.g. Regulators, Audit, Risk, and Compliance
Provide results of screening and client due diligence undertaken at the offices at agreed frequencies and work to address any CDD concerns
Periodically evaluate existing client profiles to keep client files up-to-date
Conduct enhanced due diligence and monitoring of higher-risk relationships
Review results of ongoing screening and monitoring activities to determine if further action or escalation is required, clearly documenting results and decisions made
Operate within agreed SLAs and confidentiality standards
Build trusted relationships with key internal stakeholders, including Partners, Fee Earners, PAs, and local AML/Compliance Managers
Support internal testing and audit requirements
Assist with any other AML Compliance-related matters or projects as identified and assigned by the AML Compliance Manager
Assist with developing training materials, team standards, presentations, and courses on AML compliance awareness
Engage and collaborate with team members through the presentation of ideas and recommendations regarding best practice, continuous improvement, departmental processes, policies, and procedures
Skills and Experience:
A bachelor's degree (2:1 or above preferred) or relevant work experience required
Strong understanding of AML/CTF requirements and financial crime risks associated with the range of services in the legal industry
Good relevant AML experience
Strong analytical and research skills
Experience with AML/KYC/Due Diligence processes and systems
Experience with AML monitoring and screening
Able to manage processes efficiently, with accuracy and attention to detail
A recognized AML/Compliance qualification is desirable but not essential
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal
Strong decision-making capabilities
Team player adaptable to a fast-paced and changing environment
Good planning, time management, a prioritization of skills
Able to work independently and also to liaise with other departments
Must have good knowledge of Microsoft Office applications and other productivity tools (Intapp knowledge is an advantage)
Flexible to work a reasonable shift schedule is required
Exceptional problem-solving, critical thinking, and analytical skills
Able to contribute ideas for process improvements and adapt easily to procedural changes
Positivity and the adoption of a solution-based approach in all aspects of work

title: QA Tester | WFH & Dayshift
description:
This is a remote position.
The QA Tester will lead quality assurance efforts across our platform. As the sole dedicated QA resource, you will be responsible for designing, executing, and maintaining all testing activities across mobile, web, and backend systems. This includes creating and running smoke tests, regression tests, exploratory tests, and functional test cycles. The role requires someone who can work independently, define testing standards, and ensure software releases are stable and reliable.
Key Responsibilities
1. Test Strategy & Execution
Design and execute functional, smoke, regression, and exploratory tests
Develop and maintain test plans and test cases from product specifications
Create and manage reusable regression test suites to cover critical business flows
Conduct pre-release smoke testing to validate builds in staging and production
Identify high-risk areas and prioritise testing efforts accordingly
Support release cycles by verifying hotfixes and post-deployment changes
2. Defect Management
Log and manage defects using Jira, including clear reproduction steps and severity ratings
Verify fixes and manage defect revalidation within each sprint
Provide feedback on testability and raise blockers early
3. Test Environment & Tools Management
Maintain and manage test data and environments across staging and production
Use tools like Postman for API validation and browser-based developer tools for debugging
Where possible, create or maintain lightweight automated checks (e.g. smoke tests via Cypress)
4. Collaboration
Work closely with engineers and product managers in Agile ceremonies (e.g. daily stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives)
Participate in release planning and contribute risk assessments for deployment
Collaborate with support to investigate and triage production issues
5. Continuous Improvement
Establish repeatable test processes and documentation to improve QA scalability
Recommend improvements to release processes, test coverage, and regression cycles
Drive clarity on what should be tested manually vs automated as the product scales
Requirements
Essential
3+ years experience as a QA tester in a product-led or SaaS environment
Strong knowledge of testing methodologies including smoke, regression, functional, and exploratory testing
Ability to work independently and prioritise test activities across concurrent releases
Proficient with Jira, test case management tools, and API testing (e.g. Postman)
Solid understanding of software development lifecycles and sprint-based delivery
Strong communication and documentation skills
Desirable
Experience testing platforms built with Vue.js, Laravel/PHP, and MySQL
Familiarity with automated testing frameworks such as Cypress, Playwright, or Selenium
Experience testing in a healthcare, HR tech, or workforce scheduling context
Working knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and test integration

Experience: Proven copywriting experience, ideally for Amazon or eCommerce platforms.
Skills: Strong writing skills with a focus on clarity, accuracy, and SEO; knowledge of Amazon‚Äôs content standards.

title: Accounting Officer
description:
Accounting Officer
Be part of a stable, family-oriented organization that values your career growth, and professional development.
We are looking for a driven and passionate Accounting Officer who will play a key role in ensuring financial integrity, providing valuable insights to management, and contributing to exciting projects that challenge and expand your professional skills.
At our company, we believe that our people are our greatest investment. You‚Äôll thrive in a collaborative environment that encourages innovation, continuous learning, and career advancement‚Äîboth financially and professionally.
What You‚Äôll Do
Safeguard financial accuracy and compliance by ensuring the integrity, timeliness, and reliability of records and reports‚Äîsupporting management in making sound, data-driven business decisions while meeting regulatory and policy requirements.
Lead efficient closing processes by driving seamless month-end and year-end reporting, working closely with Finance, Logistics, and other departments to deliver accurate results and strengthen cross-functional collaboration.
Champion process improvements by recommending and implementing initiatives that streamline workflows, enhance financial analysis, and optimize accounting systems‚Äîcontributing to greater operational efficiency and long-term organizational growth.
Develop people and drive strategic projects by mentoring team members, fostering a collaborative culture, and taking part in special assignments that encourage innovation, professional development, and leadership growth.
What We‚Äôre Looking For
Graduate of BS in Accountancy, CPA required.
At least 5 years of solid accounting experience, with supervisory exposure (manufacturing industry background preferred).
Proven experience in handling special projects or assignments.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to work with large data sets.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and accounting systems.
Effective leadership, people management, and organizational skills.
A growth mindset‚Äîopen to feedback, eager to learn, and ready to take on challenges.
Why Join Us?
Stable, family-oriented company culture where people are valued and respected.
Clear career pathways and opportunities for financial and professional growth.
Exposure to challenging and meaningful projects that allow you to continuously grow as a professional.
A collaborative environment where your contributions directly impact the organization‚Äôs success.

title: Senior Accountant (Australian Firm) (Remote)
description:
The Senior Accountant will be responsible for a range of tasks to help deliver Business Services work requirements to the client. The core focus is to provide high-quality work in a timely manner to a broad portfolio of clients.

About the Role
Prepare income tax returns, financial statements, and Activity Statements (BAS/IAS) for individuals, partnerships, companies, and trusts.
Attend to business-related matters for your clients, e.g., fringe benefits tax, tax planning, interim work, assessment notices, etc
Providing taxation and financial advice to companies, individuals, and partnerships.
Determine small business CGT concessions, FBT, Div. 7a and GST reconciliations and calculations
Summarise and prepare Taxable Payments Annual Reports (TPAR)
Mentor and oversee junior, intermediate accountants and colleagues
Maintaining client relationships with attendance at meetings as required and being the key contact for a portfolio of clients.

What we are looking for
The role will suit an experienced accountant who is looking for the next step in their Australian accounting professional career. Additionally, the successful candidate will have:
At least four (4) years of experience as an offshore accountant with an Australian accounting firm
Experience in Xero, MYOB, QuickBooks, APS, Handisoft or equivalent Australian tax compliance software
Strong written and verbal English communication skills for communicating with our Australian professional staff and clients
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Effective task and time management skills, awareness of job budgets and productivity targets
High degree of accuracy, attention to detail and confidentiality
A positive attitude and the desire to contribute to a high performing team

What we offer
Our colleagues are committed, client-focused, and enjoy positive work-life harmony. Bentleys offers a supportive and positive team culture, the opportunity for growth through training and career advancement, and competitive salary packages. In addition, you can expect:
20-day leave credits consumed at your discretion with up to 10 days convertible to cash
HMO on hire for yourself and dependent
Onsite training perks of free staff accommodation and travel reimbursement
Personal development opportunities
Flexible working arrangement
Prime CBD location in a 5-star eco-friendly building with generous end-of-trip facilities
You may visit our website at https://www.bentleys.com.au/

title: Inventory Analyst
description:
Company Description
 About Garrets International
Garrets International is a part of the Wrist Group. It is an experienced, always exploring maritime service partner operating in more than 700 ports and serving 35,000 seafarers worldwide. For more than 30 years, we have provided full service of provision and stores, persistently fuelling better lives on board vessels across the globe. A better life at sea is tied to health and responsibility. It is about ease; ease of mind and ease of use. Our worldwide services ‚Äì powered by technology and decades of know-how ‚Äì provide transparency, insight and speed making it easy to do business at competitive prices. That‚Äôs why our customers trust us to deliver on board, on time and on budget. We partner closely with all our customers on budget management, nutrition guidance, chef education and food waste reduction. It all starts on board.
Right where we like to be.
Garrets International LinkedIn Page: https://www.linkedin.com/company/garrets-international/
Garrets International Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/GarretsInternational

Job Description
Garrets International is looking for a Stock Analyst who will be responsible for the monthly analysis and validation of vessels‚Äô performance, which is the main contribution to the business‚Äôs gross profit.

What you'll be doing:
Monthly verification of food consumption value, through the analysis of the manning and stock reports submitted by the vessels.
Analyse Consumption trends, product usage and purchases to identify key patterns and insights.
Provide recommendations for improving consumption efficiency with delivering monthly analysis internally on performance.
Monthly closure of stocks on all vessels by the deadline set by Garrets management and external clients.
Effective communication and collaboration with all internal and external stake holders to ensure efficient query resolution.
Delivery of SLAs on response time to client/vessel queries
Understanding the functionality of the vessel platform, and providing troubleshooting support when necessary
Setting up a new vessels data, including verification of its opening stock.
Onboarding new clients ‚Äì ensuring smooth efficient training where needed towards the vessel
Processing vessels exiting, and providing the relevant information to Finance, for billing purposes.
Ensuring timely and accurate validation of the vessel‚Äôs provision receipt against the purchase order
What we're looking for:
Bachelor's degree holder.
At least 5-7 years of one of the following
Data analyst experience
Inventory management.
Supply Chain forecasting.
Food Stores and cost of goods management 
Experience in customer-facing roles.
Experience in Microsoft Office, with a minimum of intermediate in Excel.
Knowledge of ERP system (AX2012 is an advantage).
Have a flair for numbers and an analytic mindset.
Understanding of global food consumption trends is an advantage but not a requirement.
Quick learner of processes and new systems
Are highly driven to assist your team in achieving its monthly KPIs
Have business-level communication skills in English, written and spoken.
Experience in Food Management is preferred; but not a requirement.
 Location: Times Plaza Building, U.N. Avenue corner Taft Avenue, Manila
Work Set up: Work Onsite

title: [URGENT HIRE] HR/Payroll Generalist | Permanent WFH | US Tech Startup
description:
You could be a Payroll/HR Generalist anywhere. Why Jerry.ai?
Join a pre-IPO startup with capital, traction, and runway ($240M funded | 60X revenue growth in 5 years | $2T market size).
Work in a flexible, distributed environment that values your time and supports career growth.
Collaborate with brilliant leaders and teammates from Deloitte, KPMG, McKinsey, BCG, Bain, Amazon, Facebook, Alibaba, Microsoft, Nvidia, Tencent, ByteDance, and more.
Be immersed in a talent-dense environment where you‚Äôll learn fast and help scale our people operations globally.

What we offer
Permanent Work from Home (WFH), approximately 40 hours per week
Direct hire (Preference for candidates seeking long term opportunities)
Equipment allowance after 90-day probationary period
15 days of paid vacation leave, 9 days of paid sick leave
Paid holiday leave on US holidays observed by the Company
13th month pay in December
Collaborative and supportive team


About the Opportunity
We‚Äôre looking for a Payroll/HR Generalist (Philippines-based) who is detail-oriented, organized, and passionate about building accurate and reliable HR systems. In this role, you‚Äôll manage the backbone of our HR operations ‚Äî from HRIS data integrity and employee file management to People Team inbox support and employment verification.
This isn‚Äôt a routine back-office role. You‚Äôll play a critical part in ensuring our HR records are accurate, our employee inquiries are resolved with care, and our systems are ready to support a fast-scaling global team.


How you will make an impact
Maintain HRIS and payroll systems with accuracy, auditing regularly and ensuring data integrity across employee lifecycle events.
Process timecard corrections, leave requests, PTO approvals, and payroll adjustments (hours, garnishments, benefits).
Manage the People Team inbox, triaging inquiries, escalating as needed, and ensuring timely responses.
Process employment verifications and prepare supporting documentation.
Maintain HR files and employee records in compliance with internal standards and legal requirements.
Support HR audits and reporting by ensuring records are complete and audit-ready.
Partner with HR colleagues to improve administrative workflows and implement best practices.

Ideal Profile
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field (or equivalent experience).
3-5 years of experience in HR administration, record-keeping, and US/CAN payroll/benefits support (multinational experience a plus).
Strong organizational skills with a high attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, able to explain HR processes to employees in a clear, empathetic way.
Ability to manage confidential information with discretion and integrity.
Proactive problem-solver who takes ownership and delivers reliably.
About Jerry.ai
Jerry.ai is America‚Äôs first and only super app to radically simplify car ownership. We are redefining how people manage one of their most expensive and time-consuming assets.
Powered by AI and machine learning, Jerry.ai simplifies and automates car ownership while providing personalized services for all car-related needs. From car insurance and financing to maintenance and safety, Jerry.ai does it all.
We are the #1 rated and most downloaded app in our category with a 4.7 star rating in the App Store and more than 5 million customers ‚Äî and we‚Äôre just getting started.
Founded in 2017 by serial entrepreneurs, Jerry.ai has raised over $240 million in financing and is on a mission to disrupt a massive market.
Join us and help build HR operations that scale with speed, accuracy, and care.

title: Sales Executive - B2B Outbound | WFH Philippines P40,000 BASE + UNCAPPED COMMS
description:
Company Overview:
Our client is a leading provider of cutting-edge phone services for both businesses and residences, complemented by state-of-the-art smart security systems, all delivered via cloud-based software service platforms. We are currently spearheading a dynamic B2B sales campaign that demands a deeper level of expertise and sophistication than traditional consumer selling. This is a graveyard shift schedule.
Compensation: Php 40,000 Base Salary per month plus uncapped commission. 
Sales Executives can earn Php 1,000,000++ annually
Average monthly earnings @ Php 75,000++, Super Stars earn Php 100,000++
Uncapped bonus commissions
Position Overview:
We are seeking dedicated, results-driven B2B sales professionals to join our team as Sales Executives, focusing on outbound B2B clients. As a Sales Executive, your mission will be to engage with cold leads and prospective clients, conveying information about our services in a personable and authentic manner. This role is tailored for seasoned salespeople with a background in consultative and solution-based sales strategies. Effective outbound sales agents should possess outstanding communication skills, a penchant for research, and a genuine interest in understanding potential clients and customers. If you can devise innovative approaches to engage with customers and boost sales, this role is ideal for you.
Key Responsibilities (including but not limited to):
Exceed assigned sales targets by proactively cold calling, qualifying potential leads, and guiding customers through the sales process to closure.
Cultivate and convert prospects identified through cold calling, maintaining ongoing contact through phone and email within a fast-paced, results-oriented environment.
Skillfully address objections and concerns raised by prospects and customers.
Manage the sales funnel and nurture leads from initial contact to successful closure.
Strategize and execute sales activities that align with the organization's growth objectives.
Effectively present the features and benefits of our product offerings, identify pain points, and employ solution-based selling techniques.
Maintain meticulous records of prospect interactions using designated tools and CRM systems to ensure streamlined lead management.
Job Requirements:
A minimum of 4 years of proven experience in B2B outbound sales, encompassing the end-to-end sales process.
At least 3 years of account management experience and/or a history of client-focused solutions selling.
Demonstrated ability to actively listen and persuasively communicate.
Exceptional communication skills, enabling effective presentations and the capacity to influence decision makers at all organizational levels.
Proven proficiency in presentation and negotiation skills.
A track record of cultivating and sustaining customer relationships that fuel revenue growth.
Familiarity with sales forecasting and pipeline management that consistently delivers results.
Self-motivated and capable of thriving in a performance-driven environment that rewards high achievers.
Experience with Salesforce.com is considered a valuable asset.
Equipment Requirements:
Must have a laptop/desktop that meets the minimum qualifications:
Windows Processor:
Core i5 or higher
RAM - 8GB or higher
MAC is NOT supported
Bandwidth Requirements Minimum:
Download Speed: at least 6 Mbps 
Upload Speed: at least 6 Mbps 
Dual Monitors - 19 Inches and a Headset
A quiet, private place in your home where you can work without background
If you are an accomplished B2B sales professional with the expertise to excel in a consultative, results-driven sales environment, we encourage you to explore this exciting opportunity and contribute to our continued success.
About 1840 & Company
1840 & Company is a global leader in Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) and remote talent solutions, dedicated to propelling businesses forward through our comprehensive suite of services. We specialize in connecting companies with world-class freelance professionals and delivering top-tier outsourcing services, across over 150 countries worldwide.
Our mission is to empower growth for forward-thinking businesses, seamlessly bridging any skill or resource gaps with our expertly vetted talent pool. We firmly believe in fostering an environment where exceptional individuals can achieve an optimal work-life balance, working remotely from any location, while maximizing their professional growth and earning potential.
We are headquartered in Overland Park, KS, USA with service delivery facilities in the Philippines, India, Ukraine, South Africa and Argentina. We invite you to explore the opportunities we offer and consider joining our exclusive network of global freelance talent. Visit www.1840andco.com to learn more about us. To explore a wealth of career opportunities and find a role that suits your unique skills and aspirations, please visit our dedicated jobs portal at jobs.1840andco.com

title: Client Accounting Services Associate/Senior Associate (Remote work, US clients)
description:
At Excelsior, we are dedicated to excellence, employing top-tier professionals for personalized Client Accounting and Transaction Advisory Services.
Our golden rule is "happy employees make happy clients." Some of the ways our golden rule plays out include:
Compensation, Benefits and Stipends - Even though we are a small company, we offer a generous compensation and benefits package which we are working to grow each year. For our Philippine team, you will have benefits packages including 13th month pay, HMO coverage, home office reimbursements, miscellaneous allowances, paid time-off.
Schedule - You will also have the flexibility of working under normal Philippine hours and enjoy your after-work hours with your family and friends.
Great Clients! ‚Äì We are very picky with who we take on as a client and only seek out clients we believe will treat our employees with kindness and respect.
Variety ‚Äì This job provides the opportunity to work in a start-up style environment and service a variety of different clients that come in all shapes and sizes ‚Äì for-profit and nonprofit, large and small, simple, and complex. It is ideal for those who seek intellectual stimulation with their workday.
Community Support ‚Äì We withhold certain percent of revenues and once a year, each team member gets to choose a nonprofit to receive a donation with their share of the funds. We also provide one free hour of services per day to each of our nonprofit clients.
Community Service ‚Äì We encourage our employees to be involved in the community through pre-approved volunteer activities that will serve a variety of community organizations.
Training and Others - We also offer various training opportunities, ongoing professional development / CPE expenses, employee engagement, and work-life balance.

We are seeking an initiative-taking and highly driven accounting professional to join our Client Accounting Services team as an Associate or a Senior Associate. In this role, you will serve US clients and will work on various projects such as processing billing, collections and vendor payments, completing accounts reconciliations and analysis, preparing journal entries, participating in month-end financial close process, preparing schedules required for clients' financial statement audits and reviewing financial transactions for reasonableness, accuracy and completeness. The ideal candidate will have well-rounded skillsets to be able to manage a variety of tasks and situations effectively and adapt to the rigors and challenges associated with client work. The person in this position will work remotely from the Philippines under normal Philippine work hours.

Responsibilities:
Apply knowledge of accounting principles in processing and recording financial transactions.
Assist in the day-to-day function for clients' accounts receivable and grant receivable process such as timely and accurate billing, collections, recordkeeping, and reporting.
Assist in the day-to-day function for clients' accounts payable cycle such as making sure that bills are properly supported and approved for payment before processing payment. Also, data entry, properly classifying payments to accounts and monitoring unpaid bills.
Assist in maintaining the general ledger, including preparing journal entries, and ensuring accurate posting of transactions.
Review of account transactions for reasonableness, accuracy, and completeness.
Complete monthly account reconciliations and analysis, including bank reconciliations, subsidiary ledger to general ledger balance reconciliations, vendor reconciliations, customer reconciliations, intercompany account reconciliations, accounts receivable/payable aging analysis, prepaid expense analysis, inventory reconciliations and analysis, analysis of deposits, fixed asset roll forward analysis and depreciation/amortisation schedule, note payable amortisation schedule, accrual calculations, and suspense account analysis.
Perform certain payroll-related tasks including payroll data entry for hours worked, payroll processing subject to client approval, post-payroll retirement contribution submissions, recording of payroll activity on the books, payroll accruals and analysis.
Prepare month-end close financial workbook with supporting documentation and analysis.
Assist in the preparation of schedules and analysis required by auditors for annual audit of clients' financial statements.
Assist in the preparation of tax schedules required by tax preparers at year-end.
Support other month-end and year-end close processes such as aiding in the preparation of financial statements, forecasts, and budgets, as required.
Collaborate with various stakeholders to improve the financial statement and internal control processes, as necessary.
All other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or related field
Proven track record in client service or in bookkeeping preferably with at least 3 years of combined experience in public accounting and in the private sector as an accountant
Minimum of 1 year of public accounting experience required
Minimum of 2 years of private sector accounting experience required
Experience in an international company environment a plus
An active CPA licence is preferred although comparable professional experience is also acceptable
Willing to work remotely under normal Philippine work hours
Experience with ERP systems (QuickBooks, Xero, Sage, Bill.com, Ramp, Financial Edge, MIP Fund Accounting, etc.) and knowledge of Microsoft applications (Excel, Word, Powerpoint)
Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills
Strong attention to accuracy and detail
Highly organised and ability to accomplish multiple tasks, projects, and goals
Effective interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team

If you believe you met the above qualifications and have the skills and experience to take on the responsibilities of this role, you are invited to apply. Please send us your Resume along with a cover letter that summarises your qualifications and a short statement of why you are a good fit for the job.

Thank you. We look forward to receiving your applications.

title: IT Security Specialist - Part Time
description:
Location: Fully Remote (Open to applicants based in Asia only)Work Hours: Part-Time, Monday to Friday: 8:00 PM - 12:00 MN (UTC+08:00)
About CoreBridge SolutionsCoreBridge Solutions is an innovative leader in the business services industry, known for integrating advanced technology to deliver precise and efficient solutions. Our firm excels in various sectors including legal, financial, medical, and marketing, bringing cutting-edge solutions to complex business challenges. At CoreBridge, we harness the power of AI and other advanced technologies to set new industry standards, ensuring our clients receive unparalleled service and outcomes.
Job Overview
We are seeking a dedicated IT Security Specialist to join our team and safeguard our digital assets. In this role, you'll be responsible for developing and implementing security measures that protect sensitive data and ensure compliance with industry standards. As a key player in our cybersecurity efforts, you will monitor our network for security breaches and respond promptly to incidents. You‚Äôll also work closely with our IT and development teams to incorporate security best practices across all systems and applications. If you are passionate about cybersecurity and want to make a significant impact, apply today to join our dynamic team!
Key Responsibilities:
Develop and Implement Security Strategies: Design and enforce IT security policies, standards, and procedures to protect the organization‚Äôs information assets.
Conduct Security Audits: Perform regular security assessments and vulnerability tests to identify potential risks and implement corrective actions.
Monitor Network Traffic: Continuously monitor network activity to detect unusual patterns and investigate potential security breaches.
Manage Security Tools: Administer security tools, including firewalls, antivirus software, and intrusion detection systems, to ensure optimal performance and protection.
Collaborate with IT Teams: Work with IT and development teams to integrate security practices into system designs and operational processes.
Respond to Security Incidents: Lead incident response efforts, conduct investigations, and implement recovery measures following security breaches.
Stay Updated on Security Trends: Keep abreast of the latest security threats, trends, and technologies to proactively address emerging risks.
Qualifications:
Proven Success in Cybersecurity: Demonstrated experience in IT security roles, with a track record of effectively managing cybersecurity operations.
Relevant Certification: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Information Technology, Cybersecurity, or a related field, along with relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or CEH.
Strong Skills in Security Technologies: Proficiency in managing security tools and technologies, including firewalls, IDS/IPS, VPNs, and encryption solutions.
Analytical Skills: Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills to identify vulnerabilities and develop effective security solutions.
Attention to Detail: Strong attention to detail and commitment to maintaining high-security standards.
Effective Communication: Ability to communicate complex security concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively.
Why Join CoreBridge Solutions?At CoreBridge, you‚Äôll be part of a company that values innovation and efficiency, with a track record of transforming industry standards and leading technology advancements. Our team is made up of passionate individuals who strive to provide solutions that not only meet but exceed our customers' expectations. Join us and contribute to our mission to redefine the digital landscape, one project at a time.
Benefits:
Remote work flexibility with the opportunity to work from anywhere in Asia.
Performance-related bonuses celebrating significant milestones.
A focus on professional development within the spheres of leadership and digital marketing innovation.
Commitment to maintaining a healthy work-life balance with a 20-hour workweek.
Work Environment Notice:
CoreBridge Solutions is dedicated to maintaining a productive, safe, and efficient work environment for all team members. To support this commitment, we use a live monitoring system during working hours. By applying for this position, you acknowledge and accept this monitoring process as part of your role. This system helps us ensure a supportive and effective work environment for everyone.
Apply Now:
Ready to make an impact? Please fill out the application form. We look forward to learning more about you and how you can contribute to our team.

description:

Wrist is the world‚Äôs leading ship and offshore supplier of marine provisions and stores with a market share of approximately 12%.
With the launch of the digital marketplace, Source2Sea, Wrist is leading the digital transformation of the marine supply industry. All year round, we offer 24/7 global online sourcing and logistics, providing data transparency, automation, and convenience to our customers.
We continuously work on reducing our climate impact while at the same time proactively addressing our customers‚Äô growing demand and need for responsible solutions and services.
From more than 30 locations worldwide, in all major shipping locations, 1,800 Wrist employees take pride in making it easy for our customers to order and receive marine supplies and services.
Wrist LinkedIn Page: https://www.linkedin.com/company/wrist-ship-supply/
Wrist Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/wristshipsupply/
Job Description
The Buy-to-Order (BTO) Purchaser is responsible for sourcing and coordinating the just-in-time supply of items in an efficient, punctual, and cost-competitive fulfillment of request for quotations and orders of the vessel.
This role focuses on optimizing the inventory of Wrist items to minimize usage on miscellaneous codes, while obtaining quotes for non-stock items and ensuring that all procurement process from order through invoice management are handled effectively.

What you'll be doing:
Strategic RFQ Management
Utilize your expertise to translate customer request to Wrist codes, effectively streamlining the process while reducing the reliance on miscellaneous (MISC) items.
Play and active role in assessing the assortment, leveraging your understanding of market trends and customer preferences to make informed recommendations on assortment changes.
Collaborate with Sales in responding to request for quotations (RFQs) with efficiency and accuracy, including obtaining quotes for items not presently in stock.
Manage end-to-end process of customer quotes, receiving and tendering responses with utmost professionalism.
Ensure that all quotations are prepared and submitted to respective sales responsible within customer-specified deadline.
Supplier Engagement and Quote Acquisition
Maintain a healthy relationship with vendors to secure timely and competitive quotes for items specified in RFQs and in line with the vendor trade agreements and contracts.
Leverage negotiation skills to obtain favorable pricing and terms, aligning with Wrist commitment to cost competitiveness.
Facilitate seamless communication with local vendors ensuring deliveries are aligned perfectly with just-in-time principle.
Order Fulfillment Oversight
Oversee the end-to-end process of order fulfillment, from initial RFQ to final delivery.
Ensure that all follow-up activities, including order tracking, status updates and delivery coordination are executed flawlessly.
Collaborate with Sales to ensure timely and comprehensive order confirmation.
Actively manage and optimized stock item usage.
Cross-Functional Collaboration
Foster strong partnerships with Sales and Procurement teams, harnessing collective expertise to achieve shared goals.
Coordinate with various departments to ensure availability of all requisitioned items, contributing to flawless delivery timeliness.
Invoice and Documentation Management
Execute Buy-to-Order (BTO) orders with finesse, encompassing diverse tasks such as invoice clearing, facilitating return goods and more.
Continuously maintain and enhance procurement Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) within your area of expertise, driving process excellence.
What we're looking for:
Experience in purchasing particularly within the maritime or shipping industry.
Familiarity of maritime regulations and food safety standards to ensure compliance on the maritime requirements.
Proficient in using ERP systems (Microsoft AX12) and Microsoft office.
Demonstrates exceptional interpersonal skills, adept to foster a positive relationship with colleagues, vendors, and stakeholders.
Proactively make suggestions to the available item assortment and ways of working that will drive improved speed in the quotation process.
Location: Times Plaza Building, U.N. Avenue corner Taft Avenue, Manila
Work Set up: Work Onsite
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
SUBMIT YOUR APPLICATIONS AT: https://smrtr.io/tbwSn

As a global company, we aim to reflect the communities we are part of, believing that our strength comes from diverse perspectives, experiences, and the unique contributions each person offers.

title: Data Entry / Compliance Officer
description:

title: Medical Biller
description:
Job Title: Medical Biller with QuickBooks Experience
Location: Remote
Job Type: Full-Time
Remote VA PH is currently seeking an experienced Medical Biller with expertise in QuickBooks to join our client's healthcare team. This role involves handling all aspects of medical billing, payment posting, claims submission, and accounts management. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of medical billing procedures, insurance guidelines, and proficiency in QuickBooks for managing financial records and reconciliations
Key Responsibilities
Medical Billing: Prepare, review, and submit medical claims to insurance companies.
Claims Management: Handle denied or rejected claims, investigate and correct billing errors, and resubmit claims to maximize reimbursement.
Accounts Receivable: Track and manage accounts receivable, follow up on unpaid claims, and initiate collections for overdue accounts.
Payment Posting: Accurately post payments from insurance companies, government programs, and patients into the accounting system.
QuickBooks Management: Utilize QuickBooks to record financial transactions, reconcile accounts, manage patient invoices, and generate financial reports.
Patient Communication: Interact with patients to discuss billing issues, set up payment plans, and resolve any billing questions or disputes.
Compliance: Ensure billing practices comply with healthcare regulations, HIPAA, and insurance standards.
Reporting: Prepare reports on revenue, outstanding accounts, and billing productivity for management review.
Requirements
Experience: Proven work experience in medical billing, with experience in QuickBooks required.
Knowledge: Strong understanding of medical terminology, ICD-10, CPT codes, and insurance claims processing.
Skills: Proficiency in QuickBooks, Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word), and billing software.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills for interacting with patients, insurance companies, and internal staff.
Attention to Detail: Strong organizational skills and attention to detail to ensure accuracy in billing and financial records.
Benefits
Easy Hiring Process
Work-from-home opportunities
Weekly pay-out
